title: This clever gadget uses your lamp to charge your tech
text:
The benefit of almost all our devices having rechargeable batteries is that we don't have to worry about stocking our drawers with AA and AAA batteries anymore. 
The downside is that our outlets get clogged with different plugs and adapters. 
I'm a big fan of multi-use gadgets, which is why I'm recommending the LampChamp to people who want to make the most out of the space they have. 
The LampChamp is a USB hub that screws into the fixture of any lamp. Setting it up is relatively simple: You take out your current light bulb, screw the LampChamp into your lamp, and screw your bulb into the LampChamp. Any standard-sized bulb will work, and if your bulb doesn't fit, Olens Technology (the creators of the LampChamp) will send you an adapter. 
It doesn't have as many ports as other USB hubs I've recommended, but the two it does have should be sufficient if you use the LampChamp with a lamp you have next to your bed. It eliminates the problem of having to choose whether to charge your phone, use your lamp, or buy a surge protector . 
I've been faced with this choice dozens of times and I've always chosen my phone over light. 
This tech accessory is mostly about convenience; apartment dwellers like myself often have to find creative ways to keep all of our devices charged without stringing cables everywhere. At 2-amps, the USB ports on the LampChamp might actually charge your phone more quickly than the adapter that comes with your phone, which is a nice bonus. Best of all, this doesn't interrupt your use of your lamp. 
If outlets are at a premium where you live, but lamps are plenty, it's well worth checking the LampChamp out â€” those of us with overhead lighting will have to come up with our own solution.
